pageContext.markings:
On the reverse:
- top stretcher member, centre, paper label (4.4 x 7.0 cm), brown ink, quill, handwritten in Old German (altdeutsche Schrift): 'Samlung v. Graimberg / Dr. Martin Luther / ohne Zeichen und Numer'
- on the right, black pen (ballpoint ?), capitals: 'G 68'
- left stretcher member, bottom, vertical, stamp, blue ink (?), type face facing outwards: 'KURPFÄLZISCHES MUSEUM / DER STADT HEIDELBERG'
- below, vertical: pencil (?), type face facing outwards: '215'
- bottom stretcher member, centre, black ballpoint pen (?), capitals: 'Werkstatt - Lucas Cranach- / G 68 Martin Luther'
- centre, below, paper label (1.5 x 5.5 cm), brown ink, quill, handwritten in Old German (altdeutsche Schrift): '614 / pour la galerie'
- canvas, centre, stamp, blue ink (?): 'KURPFÄLZISCHES MUSEUM / DER STADT HEIDELBERG'
- below: black felt tip pen (?), capitals: 'G 68'
[Kurpfälzisches Museum Heidelberg, revised 2020]

metadata.title: Portrait of Martin Luther

pageContext.provenance:
- from the Graimberg Collection, 1879 (Leger no. 19 or 18)
- since 1996 on loan to the university museum (Universitätsmuseum), Heidelberg
[Kurpfälzisches Museum Heidelberg, revised 2020]

restorationSurveys.overallAnalysis:
- stable condition, numerous conservation treatments
Support: 
- annotation on a old index card: 'Öl auf Leinwand auf Holz aufgezogen.' (oil on canvas, laminated on wood) unclear whether it refers to an original or later marouflage, probably removed in the 1970s and lined with a plain weave canvas (thightly woven thick thread), adhesive appears to be paste, attached to a stretcher, the original tacking margin is cropped on all sides and ends about 0.2 cm before the turnover edge 
Ground/ Paint layers: 
the layers should good adhesion; large areas of crushed paint caused by pressure during the lining process, the weave texture is clearly visible on the surface; the surface recalls that of a counterproof print possibly due to the softening of the paint during the lining; numerous losses, particularly in the background and the gown, have been filled and retouched
Coating:
- the last coating was a dammar varnish, it has sunk in areas of retouching, uneven surface gloss 
[Kurpfälzisches Museum Heidelberg, revised 2020]

restorationSurveys.remarks: Painting: retouching renewed with watercolours, application of dammar varnish

Frame: mitred joins at the bottom left and top right reglued, additional battens were added to the reverse, the rebate was cushioned with felt, reframed, a hardboard backing was attached to the reverse

tests.text: - plain weave canvas with thin thread tightly woven
- there appear to be two layers of ground, a white and a reddish brown pigmented application

- pigments susoended in an oil-based medium; paint applied in numerous relatively opaque layer; details in the flesh paint and hair defined by delicate lines 
- there is probably no original coating

- probably 20th century in the style of an italian renaissance frame: a plaited central band (painted with ocher and flanked by two bands of gilded egg and dart motif 
- square wooden panels are attached to the corners; these are decorated with round metal ornaments fixed with nails
[Kurpfälzisches Museum Heidelberg, revised 2020]
